name: Cina
Relationship: Antidote; CAMPH.; CAPS.Compare: SANTONIN - (often preferable in worm affections; same symptoms as Cina; corresponding to the pain in shocks produced by Cina. Visual illusions, YELLOW sight; violent light not recognized, colors not distinguishable. Urine deep saffron color. Spasms and twitchings, chronic gastric and intestinal troubles sometimes removed by a single dose (physiological) of Santonin. (Dahlke.) HELMINTHOCHORTOS - Worm-moss (acts very powerfully on intestinal worms, especially the lumbricoid.) TEUCRIUM; IGNAT.; CHAM.; SPIG.

Eyes: Eyestrain, especially when presbyopia sets in
Fever: Cold sweat on forehead, nose, and hands
Much hunger; colicky pains; chilliness, with thirst
Much fever, associated with clean tongue
In Cina fever, face is cold and hands warm
Stomach: Vomiting and diarrhoea immediately after eating and drinking
Gets hungry soon after a meal
Epigastric pain; worse, first waking in morning and before meals
Modalities: Worse: looking fixedly at an object
Mind: Desires many things, but rejects everything offered
Abnormal consciousness, as if having committed some evil deed
Child VERY CROSS; does not want to be touched, or crossed, or carried
Stool: White mucus, like small pieces of popped corn, preceded by pinching colic
Turbid, white; turns milky on standing
Face: WHITE AND BLUISH ABOUT THE MOUTH
PALE, hot, WITH DARK RINGS AROUND EYES
CHOREIC MOVEMENTS OF FACE and hands
Respiratory: Child is afraid to speak of move for fear of bringing on paroxysm of coughing
After coughing, moaning, anxious, gasps for air and turns pale
Cough so violent as to bring tears and sternal pains; feels as if something had been torn off
GURGLING FROM THROAT TO STOMACH AFTER COUGHING
Violent recurring paroxysms, as of down in throat
Sleep: Night terrors of children; cries out, screams, wakes frightened
Child gets on hands and knees in sleep; on abdomen
Nose: WANTS TO RUB IT and pick at it
Itching of nose all the time
BORES AT NOSE till it bleeds
Head: Headache, alternating with pain in abdomen
Pain in head when using eyes
Relieved by stooping
Extremities: Paralyzed shocks; patient will jump suddenly, as though in pain
Left foot in constant spasmodic motion
SUDDEN INWARD JERKING OF FINGERS OF RIGHT HAND

TWITCHING and jerking distortion of limbs, trembling

details: This is a children's remedy, - big, fat, rosy, scrofulous, corresponding to many conditions that may be referred to intestinal irritation, such as worms and accompanying complaints. An irritability of temper, variable appetite, grinding of teeth, and even convulsions, with screams and violent jerkings of the hands and feet, are all within its range of action. The Cina patient is hungry, cross, ugly, and wants to be rocked. PAIN IN SHOCKS. Skin sensitive to touch.
dosage: Third attenuation. For nervous irritable children, thirtieth and two hundredth preferable.SANTONIN in first (with care) and third trituration.
